Description:
Idyllic Townhouse with a Homely Heart
Privately nestled at the front of a four-unit complex. Overlooking Harry Trott Reserve.
- Master bedroom with ensuite

- Ducted gas heating, evaporative cooling & ducted vacuum.
- Paved private courtyard.
- Auto single garage. Circular private drive at front.

Description:
Kennington townhouse for investors or empty nesters.
The perfect blend of lifestyle and location awaits new owners in this neat townhouse situated in a quiet cul-de-sac off St Aidens Road handy to Strath and Kennington Village shopping centres, LaTrobe University, schools, Kennington Reservoir and associated recreational areas.
A solid investment, downsizer or first buy, the brick veneer home features two bedrooms (with built-in robes) positioned beside the bathroom, separate lounge and roomy kitchen meals/living opening to a wide rear verandah perfect for outdoor dining and entertaining.
The kitchen includes electric cooking appliances and good storage while as-new carpets, ducted heating and cooling flow throughout.
The single garage encompasses the laundry and enjoys personal access to the kitchen for added security.
The private and fully-fenced rear yard includes two rainwater tanks and garden shed with gated side access for a trailer, caravan etc. - making it an ideal lock-and-leave property for grey nomads.
Great value for owner-occupiers or investors, it's currently leased until January 19 to an excellent tenant for $250 per week, who would be keen to stay on, but vacant possession is available.
Insights: 6 Kate Close, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2019 and 17 other 2 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
Spacious Home in a Sought-after Location
Here is a fantastic opportunity to buy an affordably priced home is what is one of the prime streets in a wonderfully popular Kennington location. Set on a generous block or 716 m2 approx, conveniently close to the CBD, La Trobe University, shopping, medical centres and public transport.
The property has been a long term, well cared-for rental and has scope to update and modernise to suit your needs and would be ideal for both the investor or home owner.
The house has high ceilings with wide cornices, glass fronted sliding doors open to the spacious lounge which has large double aspect windows and a gas space heater. A separate dining or study room leads off this room, while a casual meals area adjoins the kitchen which has glass fronted overhead cupboards, built-in pantry and a gas upright stove. The three carpeted bedrooms are all of a good size, with two having built-in robes and are located off a carpeted hallway with generous and very handy storage cupboards. The bathroom possesses a bath, shower and vanity with the toilet separate and the laundry has the convenience of a second separate toilet. The driveway along the right side of the house leads to a large twin door double garage in the rear yard with an attached undercover entertainment area and a nearby small lawn area with a storage or garden shed. There is also a large concrete standing area suitable for extra vehicles, plus trailer or caravan etc. This prime location property deserves an inspection.
Property Code: 915

Description:
History's Charm with todays features inside...
Charming, comfortable, well-located, character, cottage-like Do we go on? These are the descriptive terms that suit this property.
Charming because it reflects a bygone era in Bendigo history, but offers modern living with spacious living areas that have been updated; The bathroom, kitchen, and dining area, but more on that later.
The location in Neale Street, being much sought after in Kennington couldn't be better. On a corner block with Neale St frontage and side access from Ligar Street, make it perfect for secure parking. The back yard is easy care and features a garage in the corner of the block. It also lends itself to the garden lovers with a blank canvas to create a perfect escape. There is also off street parking beside the house off Neale St.
The feature Bull Nose verandah at the front takes you into a short, polished floorboard hallway that opens up on your left to the extended lounge with the traditional casement window overlooking the front garden. On the right-hand side, you find 3 spacious bedrooms also off a short hallway, featuring polished floors and high ceilings. Further into the house you discover the dining area, and the kitchen combined. Delightful for holding a private dinner party or intimate soiree.... the kitchen area is light filled and fully equipped with oodles of bench space, storage cupboards and large drawers. Gas cook top, dishwasher and large oven with overhead range.
The bathroom is to the rear and features shower recess, bathtub, and separate vanity. This is spacious, so you can pamper yourself in comfort.
Important features like underfloor central heating, evaporative cooling and split system air conditioning/heating are already in.
Inspect this property with confidence! Its sound, and most of the expensive items have been taken care of, well positioned in a very popular and appealing area of Bendigo and will appeal to a wide range of buyers. Presently tenanted, but vacant possession can be negotiated as a month to month tenancy is in place.
Come to the open inspection times to appreciate what an opportunity is on offer here.
Insights: 70 Neale Street, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2019 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
An original cream bricker with sub-division options!
- Very appealing original cream bricker ideal for investment in this bluechip locale
- Offering 2 bedrooms and original bathroom with character and charm
- Separate spacious kitchen/meals area and separate Lounge area
- A great 580m2 block with potential to build behind (STCA)
- Gas heating and split system reverse for all seasons
- Opportunity to restore to the home's former glory e.g. polished timber floors
- Single carport and garden shed
- Close to schools, University, bus, shops and all amenities
This lovely cream brick home on a great block offers great potential to lease out immediately and/or renovate to add value in this high growth area of Kennington. A very appealing home in a highly sought after area this home will appeal to those wanting to live only minutes from the CBD and close to all amenities.

Description:
Prime Position - Classic Cream BV
Positioned proud and located at the Paris end of popular Lowndes Street, is this very functional and well-presented cream brick veneer home.
Sited on over 750m2 of prime Kennington land, the opportunity to invest, purchase and extend is evident here.
Original with some minor updates throughout, you can move in and start planning your full renovation.
The 3 bedrooms are all of a very good size, in particular the 7.4m x 3.5m main bedroom.
The L-shaped kitchen/meals/lounge area has birdseye views to the front and rear.
The separate shower room with vanity and separate bathroom with vanity are uniquely placed to transform your renovation also. Ducted heating and wall mounted air-conditioning.
Established yard, mudroom, garage and front verandah.
Minutes to schools including Kennington Primary, St. Therese's, BSE Secondary and Victory Christian College.
Kennington and Strath Villages, Strath Hill, Aldi, La Trobe Uni and Kennington Reservoir are also just minutes away.
Perfect on so many levels.

Description:
In The Heart of Kennington
Fall in love with this flawlessly preserved 1960's Family home. Perfect for the first homebuyer, renovator or investor, this three bedroom one bathroom features a large living area with built in fireplace, adjoining a light filled sunroom, perfect for relaxing in with your morning coffee whilst overlooking the established front yard. Sliding doors open into a homely dining area, and through to the original kitchen with ample cupboard space. All three bedrooms are robed, bathroom with shower, bath and a separate toilet. Great heating and cooling for all year round comfort. The entire interior is in well-maintained original condition with scope to add value through updates or a full renovation. Fantastic secured backyard and single garage/shed, this peaceful and private space provides an excellent area to dine, recline and entertain family and friends. Located in the popular sort after Kennington area, close to all amenities including Kennington Reservoir, supermarkets, La Trobe University, Bendigo South East College, sporting facilities and a short drive to the CBD. Don’t delay, this gem won’t last long, call to arrange an inspection today.

Description:
ENJOY STUNNING SUNSET VIEWS FROM YOUR ALFRESCO/POOL AREA
If you fancy the idea of sipping champagne as the sun is setting, whilst floating around your own pool, then this property should be your new home!!
Made for entertaining, you will enjoy living in this home, situated in popular Mill Street, only a quick drive from Kennington Village shopping centre.
Sited on just over 700 square metres, but designed for low maintenance, you will find this property allows for "lock and leave" if your job takes you away from home regularly, or if you just enjoy travelling.
You will find this home a joy to live in and you will enjoy the upgrades of High ceilings, tall doors, soft close cabinetry, caesar stone benches, 900 mm wide oven, 5 burner cooktop and a thoughtful layout which suits a professional couple who enjoy visitors staying over, but totally having their own space. Offering 3 spacious bedrooms and a large study, balcony from the main bedroom, and luxurious ensuite, 2 living areas, roomy kitchen and a dining area that boasts a vaulted ceiling. "This quality home and features represent outstanding value for the price" …….. phone today to arrange your own personal inspection……. You will be glad you did!

Description:
Nice and Neat! First home or investment
Sitting in a quiet street in Kennington sits this 3 bedroom brick veneer home, featuring an easy-living floorplan with separate lounge and open-plan dining and kitchen.
All 3 bedrooms have built-in robes, the master even has built-in drawers as well, and all serviced by a 3-piece bathroom with a new shower and separate toilet. The home has ducted floor heating and a split-system for cooling in the lounge, with a fan transfer kit to the bedrooms. Off the kitchen-dining is an undercover, newly-built entertaining area with cafe blinds and roll out awnings for wind and weather protection, along with a lovely grassed / garden area.
Located next to a playground and within walking distance to the Strathdale shopping/cafe district, this is a home with loads to offer.

Description:
ENDURING 70'S STYLE ON McIVOR HILL
A fine specimen of the 1970's style, this architect-designed home makes a real connection with the outside through the use of glass, exposed timber and brickwork.
The split-level family home boasts two living areas with soaring raked ceilings, three larger-than-average bedrooms, two designer bathrooms and a fabulous outdoor living deck overlooking a sparkling 10m pool.
Behind the brick feature wall in the entry is a versatile room with built-in sideboard for formal dining, sitting/reading room or study. Step down to a generous lounge room with floor-to-ceiling windows providing a leafy vista at one end and opening to a sunny Merbau deck beside the pool at the other end.
The main bedroom is a parent's private sanctuary with big window to the front garden and modern ensuite/dressing room while two more bedrooms, both with built-ins are separately located beside the updated bathroom and WC.
The kitchen is a cook's delight equipped with granite bench tops over solid timber cabinetry, pantry, electric cooking appliances and Miele dishwasher.
Enjoy relaxed living inside and out with a spacious dining room adjoining the kitchen opening to an all-weather, elevated verandah overlooking the sparkling 10m pool. Best shared with others, it is the perfect place for Sunday brunch, family celebrations or just relaxing on balmy evenings.
Back inside, the spacious family living area includes a stunning feature wall of Mountain ash vertical boards surrounding a cheery gas-log fire while the rest of the residence is maintained by gas heating, ducted evaporative cooling and split system unit in the main bedroom.
The laundry has been modernised in similar fashion to the bathrooms and includes good storage options with a private, sunny courtyard alongside.
Large block approx 902m², includes well-established, easy-care native landscaping with realistic, no-mow grassed areas, double carport, garden shed and secure fencing all round.
Tucked away in a quiet cul-de-sac in the coveted McIvor Hill locale and handy to schools, supermarket, transport and sporting facilities, this property is the perfect package of lasting style and location.
Insights: 7 McIvor Court, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2019 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
PERFECTION ON ST AIDANS
They really don't come much better than this! An immaculate, quality built home on approx. 960sqm, walking distance to all the best that wonderful Kennington has to offer. 3 large bedrooms with luxurious ensuite and WIR to the main, light filled open plan modern kitchen, dining and living areas which enjoy relaxing garden vistas and desirable indoor/outdoor flow. Year around comfort is assured with ducted heating and cooling. Outside, the well maintained gardens offers sanctuary and relaxation, complete with a large powered shed/workshop, DLUG, parking for a caravan and automatic sprinkler system. Properties of such a high standard in such a desirable location are getting few and far between, inspection is a must.

Description:
Location and Position - Retirees and Investors, look no further
Overlooking the popular shopping centres of Strath Village, Kennington Village and Strath Hill is this 3-bedroom townhouse, bordering the popular suburbs of Kennington, Strathdale and Flora Hill.
Less than 500 metres to La Trobe Uni, Brennan Park swimming pool and Bendigo South East College. This brilliantly located home will tick so many boxes for various buyers.
All 3 bedrooms have space and built-in cupboards, main also with access into the 3-piece bathroom for convenience.
The separate lounge to the front leads onto one of the various courtyards/entertaining areas.
The open kitchen/meals/sitting room has loads of space and benches in the cook's domain.
Atrium style feature allows you to walk through from the single garage, giving you a good sense of security.
Ducted heating and cooling throughout also.
Outside there's no need for a lawn mower, as it is paved and set up for drought-proof gardening.
Elevated in a prestigious location, set at the foot of One Tree Hill State Forest, this is one to mark down and inspect.

Description:
Character and charm with modern style.
Situated on a 495m2 block with side access, moments from the CBD sits an impressively renovated home within a 1930's California Bungalow shell.
Renovated by a quality builder himself, the choice of the impressive front door sets the standard for what is within the four walls of this Havlin Street property, that being a warm and loving home with mindful touches.
A seamless fusion of modern living and classic period features flow from front to back including hardwood timber floors, high ceilings, modern lighting, decorative cornices, ceiling roses and clever storage complete with a tasteful colour pallet.
Located at the front of the property is the master bedroom. Upon entering this spacious master bedroom, you will see the stunning feature wall, framing the bed setting perfectly. This master bedroom is exactly that, with a well-equipped his-and-hers walk-in-robe with sensor lighting and ample storage, flowing through to the fantastic ensuite with a spacious shower, sleek vanity and enclosed toilet.
The remaining two bedrooms are in the front half of the property and share the family bathroom featuring a luxurious corner spa, great sized shower and wall hung vanity unit.
In the centre of the home is the open plan dining adjoining the charming kitchen with quality fixtures and fittings throughout. Notably, the popular white subway splashback is the focal point, surrounded by storage, rich cabinetry, a 750mm gas stove, electric oven, double sink completed by the quality stone benchtops.
From here, you step up to the fantastic, light-filled lounge room adorned with exposed beams and sleek track lighting. This area houses a great study nook and branches off to the euro laundry. French doors frame the undercover entertaining area which leads to the paved alfresco and adjoins a luscious grass patch - the perfect setting for a weekend BBQ. A water tank and shed complete the backyard.
This home ticks all the boxes. An ideal property for those looking to downsize or upsize, something to add to your portfolio or a potential Air BnB close by to the city with plenty of opportunities to explore and enjoy Bendigo.
Insights: 47 Havlin Street East, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2018 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
Contemporary Living in the Dress Circle
Located just 100m from the Kennington Reservoir on an immaculately manicured 470sqm corner allotment. Built by Russell Parsons builders and Designers, this innovative 2 storey home optimises natural light offering seamless entertaining & living spaces.
• Versatile floor plan/ 3 or 4 bedrooms, ensuite WIR.
• 2 living zones including lounge with 16ft ceilings.
• Upstairs home office with Jarrah timber floors, rumpus room/teenagers retreat.
• Private entertaining deck & picturesque established gardens.
Enjoy morning walks around the Reservoir & adjoining native reserve, within close proximity to Strathdale shopping, La Trobe University and Bendigo South East College.

Description:
Position is everything.
Recently refurbished and perfectly positioned home will appeal equally to first home buyers and baby boomer downsizers – both age groups are well aware of the real value of living close to all amenities.
Young families will be able to walk the kids to nearby schools, swimming pool and playgrounds while retirees will appreciate the close proximity to Strath and Kennington village shopping centres, public transport, medical and allied health practices and LaTrobe University.
The home offers four bedrooms (or 3+study), two bathrooms, large lounge and light-filled kitchen/meals area.
Recent improvements include paint so fresh it's barely dry, new carpets, vinyl plank flooring and blinds, new kitchen appliances - Beko electric cooktop, oven and dishwasher topped off with new bench tops and wall tiling.
The ensuite has been remodelled with new fittings and trendy subway tiling while the main bathroom and laundry have been upgraded to a more modern look.
The property includes ducted heating and cooling plus split system unit in the lounge, built-in robes, a rear verandah for alfresco dining overlooking the secure backyard, rainwater tanks, double auto garage with roller door to the backyard and secure access to the front door plus approx.
5m x 8m steel shed/workshop fitted out with power, benches and storage for the handyman.
Very low maintenance landscaping means more time to spend with family and friends, or, in the case of grey nomads, tripping around the countryside knowing all is safe and secure at home.
Insights: 3 Primrose Court, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2018 and 26 other 4 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
Value in Kennington
This lovely two bedroom brick veneer unit is located in a highly sought-after area of Kennington, and would be ideal for first home owners, independents, retirees or investors alike. With new curtains and a fresh coat of paint, this home is ready for the new owners to make their mark.
Featuring built-in robes in both bedrooms, and a large lounge with Rinnai gas heating and refrigerated cooling for year-round comfort.
The kitchen is kitted out with an electric upright stove, walk-in pantry and plenty of storage.
The three-piece bathroom is centrally located, while the laundry includes storage and external access to the lock up garage and paved rear alfresco. With just two units on the block and no body corporate to worry about, this affordably priced and perfectly located property is an easy walk to La Trobe University, doctors, sporting facilities, Bendigo Market Place, walking tracks and public transport.
Inspection is recommended.

Description:
Beautifully renovated house ready to go.
Renovated and reinvigorated inside and out, this fresh-to-the-market home does not require another cent to be spent.
The free-flowing design includes a gorgeous new kitchen with ample cabinetry, dishwasher, stainless steel gas cooktop, under-bench electric oven and range hood.
All three bedrooms include built-in robes. The crisp new bathroom shines with all-white tiling, bath, shower and vanity unit while the laundry features handy open shelving.
The lounge room includes split system air conditioner with fresh paintwork, new blinds and timber-look flooring and carpets throughout creating a modern, light-filled environment.
Outside, new low-maintenance landscaping embraces the residence with a retro garden shed and single carport behind secure double gates.
Set on approx. 562m² serving of Kennington in a quiet street close to St Therese' and Kennington Primary Schools, this renovated home is an excellent opportunity for first home buyers; a family with small children; downsizers looking to move into an already made-over home or an investor. (Rental appraisal approx $330 pw).
Call today – this one won't last!

Description:
PICK OF THE BUNCH
Elevate your living standards with this as-new, contemporary two-storey townhouse located moments from the hospital, railway station, La Trobe University and the CBD with its cafes, restaurants and shopping with public transport at your front gate.
The pick of the boutique development, this luxury townhouse features a sun-filled study with built-in cabinetry just inside the front entrance followed by a long hallway opening to two bedrooms complete with robes and ceiling fans, a powder room and sleek bathroom.
The hallway also provides direct access to the auto double garage with European laundry and clever storage hidden behind bi-fold doors.
The upper level is filled with northern light and comprises open-plan living, dining and galley-style kitchen kitted out with stone-topped island bench, good storage including pantry and a full suite of Miele appliances (gas cooktop, electric oven, pull-out range hood, dishwasher).
Spacious, north-facing living area adjoins an L-shaped balcony- the perfect place for relaxing with morning coffee or evening cocktails.
Also on the upper level, the master suite incorporates walk-in robe and impressive ensuite featuring 1200mm shower with rainfall shower head, twin vanities & WC.
Year-round internal comfort is assured with ducted heating and split system cooling. While a private Merbau deck at the rear provides a quiet spot to relax with family and friends for a barbecue or Sunday brunch. With a minimal Body corporate structure of under $90 pa, low maintenance living within easy reach of Bendigo's CBD, this luxury lifestyle will sure to impress.
